title: What direction do molecules move in diffusion? - Quora

response.answer_text: The way I learned it and the way I still know it as is diffusion is the movement of molecules along a concentration gradient. Which means the molecules will move from a region where they are highly concentrated to areas where they are less concentrated. ... It moves outside the cell where it is less concentrated.

In any diffusional process, molecules in fact move in all directions. Thinking about the diffusional pathway of a single molecule, it takes the form of a random walk. However, considering the collection of diffusing molecules as a wbole, the average direction of diffusion is down the concentration gradient, from high to low concentration.
